entry.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18723)
entry.content:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

entry.title: I’ll take Colorado’s voting laws against Georgia’s new law...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

I’ll take Colorado’s voting laws against Georgia’s new law any day—and the MBL agrees! This is a true win for democracy.

Play Ball ⚾️ !

Coors Field is expected to be the site of the 2021 All-Star Game.

denverpost.com

entry.title: "Makisha Boothe is the founder and head business coach for...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Makisha Boothe is the founder and head business coach for Sistahbiz, a Denver-based organization with a big mission: helping Black women succeed in business"

Sistahbiz gives Black women the coaching and mentorship they need to become entrepreneurs.

9news.com

This Denver-based organization is helping Black women start their own businesses

entry.title: “The more interesting part of the dustup between Weld County...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The more interesting part of the dustup between Weld County Sheriff Steve Reams and state Rep. Leslie Herod is not what you see, conservative versus liberal, reckless use of a label and two public officials in a war of words and meanings. It’s what you don’t see.

There’s a lot of history and context to unpack.”

Joey Bunch: "The more interesting part of the dustup between Weld County Sheriff Steve Reams and state Rep. Leslie Herod is not what you see, conservative versus liberal, reckless use

coloradopolitics.com

INSIGHTS | Weld County sheriff deploys political identity distraction

entry.title: "The result was the "Coming Together" initiative...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The result was the "Coming Together" initiative developed by the company, complete with an educational framework and curriculum."

Because of Them We Can by Eunique Jones

This is what the children need! Two new Black muppets are coming to Sesame Street to talk about race, Time reports. Since Sesame Street's inception in 1969, the show has tackled challenging issues related to the day's social climate in an age-appropriate way. In 1982, they debuted their episode on g...

becauseofthemwecan.com

Two New Black Muppets Are Coming To ‘Sesame Street’

This is what the children need! Two new Black muppets are coming to Sesame Street to talk about race, Time reports. Since Sesame Street's inception in 1969, the show has tackled challenging issues related to the day's social climate in an age-appropriate way. entry.title: "The Museum for Black Girls is a vibrant, immersive,...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The Museum for Black Girls is a vibrant, immersive, beautiful space, celebrating and uplifting Black women and girls all over the world. It is a place where Black girls can feel seen, safe, heard and encouraged to be just who they are."

Denver Westword

The creator of the Museum for Black Girls is just getting started.

westword.com

Charlie Billingsley Uplifts Black Women at the Museum for Black Girls

The creator of the Museum for Black Girls is just getting started.The creator of the Museum for Black Girls is just getting started.

entry.title: "It is these photos that stand out in this large and...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It is these photos that stand out in this large and diverse body of work, and most pointedly show the artist’s skill at reclamation."

The Denver Post

Zanele Muholi, "Somnyama Ngonyama/Hail the Dark Lioness," curated by Renée Mussai, through March 20 at the Center for Visual Art in Denver.

theknow.denverpost.com

Zanele Muholi is “reclaiming my Blackness” with powerful self-portraits at Denver’s Center for Visual Art

entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Blackpackers is a nonprofit that aims to address the gap in representation in the outdoors. The organization provides gear, outdoor excursions and education for free or at a reduced cost."

CBS Denver

People from all over the world vacation in the Rocky Mountains, but resorts aren’t seeing much diversity of the slopes.

denver.cbslocal.com

entry.title: "If we don't begin to focus on health equity and...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"If we don't begin to focus on health equity and positive health outcomes for all people, especially people that data shows us are not thriving, not having positive outcomes, people will continue to die."

9NEWS (KUSA)

Nurses are taking a hard look at their ranks and a top down scrutiny of a lack of diversity.

Diversifying the nursing workforce in Colorado

entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"...Our Brown Boy Joy, a company aimed at delivering uplifting messages to boys of color. At 8 years old, Dee is the CEO."

Beacon Journal

Demetrius "Dee" Davis has a new friend, and he looks just like him.

beaconjournal.com

Focus on Black-owned businesses: 8-year-old CEO uplifts kids like him with Our Brown Boy Joy

entry.title: "For people serving time in jail or prison, it may seem...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"For people serving time in jail or prison, it may seem like punishment ends on the day of release. But in fact, thousands of restrictions dictate the terms of life after incarceration, too."

NPR

There are 45,000 laws, policies and administrative sanctions in the U.S. that target people with criminal records. Reuben Jonathan Miller researches how they affect people's lives in Halfway Home.

npr.org

Out Of Prison But Still Trapped: Examining The 'Afterlife' Of Incarceration

There are 45,000 laws, policies and administrative sanctions in the U.S. that target people with criminal records. Reuben Jonathan Miller researches how they affect people's lives in Halfway Home.There are 45,000 laws, policies and administrative sanctions in the U.S. that target people with criminal records. Reuben Jonathan Miller researches how they affect people's lives in Halfway Home.

entry.title: "Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health."

The Appeal

Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health.

theappeal.org

Healthcare In The U.S. Is Still Segregated, So Community Organizations Are Taking COVID-19 Testing Into Their Own Hands

Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health.Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health.

entry.title: "The imagery of Georgia Rep. Park Cannon being dragged away...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The imagery of Georgia Rep. Park Cannon being dragged away this week at the state Capitol follows several arrests in recent years involving elected Black women. Black women on the receiving end say it’s an effort to silence their growing political power."

MsMagazine.com

Georgia Rep. Park Cannon is one of several Black women arrested or facing criminal charges because of their work in statehouses or in communities.

msmagazine.com

Law Enforcement Officers Keep Arresting Black Women Elected Officials - Ms. Magazine

Georgia Rep. Park Cannon is one of several Black women arrested or facing criminal charges because of their work in statehouses or in communities.Georgia Rep. Park Cannon is one of several Black women arrested or facing criminal charges because of their work in statehouses or in communities.

entry.content:

The Appeal

Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public investment is needed to address racial inequality in the labor market.

theappeal.org

The U.S. Economy Won’t Recover Until Black Workers Do

Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public investment is needed to address racial inequality in the labor market.Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public investment is needed to address racial inequality in the labor market.

entry.title: "It’s time to stop mythologizing Black women trying to...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It’s time to stop mythologizing Black women trying to survive in a world that doesn’t value them."

Healthline

Despite social media calls to "thank a Black woman" and the superhero status of Stacey Abrams and Amanda Gorman, we're still one of the most undervalued groups in the United States — and it's killing us.

healthline.com

As Black Women, We Need to Save Ourselves, Not the World

Despite social media calls to "thank a Black woman" and the superhero status of Stacey Abrams and Amanda Gorman, we're still one of the most undervalued groups in the United States — and it's killing us.Despite social media calls to "thank a Black woman" and the superhero status of Stacey Abrams and Amanda Gorman, we're still one of the most undervalued groups in the United States — and it's killing us.

entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in the Centennial State in recent months."

5280 Magazine

As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in Colorado since last March.

5280.com

Anti-Asian Racism Is on the Rise in Colorado

As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in Colorado since last March.As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in Colorado since last March.

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine
